com.amazon.ags.api
Class AmazonGamesClient

java.lang.Object
  com.amazon.ags.api.AmazonGamesClient
All Implemented Interfaces:
AmazonGames
public final class AmazonGamesClient
extends java.lang.Object
implements AmazonGames

This is the single entry point to access the Amazon Games Client. Upon initialization, the AmazonGamesClient will begin an attempt to authorize on a background thread. Be sure to wait for the AmazonGamesCallback before using the client.

Method Detail

initialize

public static void initialize(Activity activity,
                              AmazonGamesCallback callback,
                              java.util.EnumSet<AmazonGamesFeature> features)
Initializes the AmazonGamesClient for the given activity. It is important to always call this function in your current activity's onResume() and to ensure it is executed on the UI thread.

Parameters:
activity - the active activity at the time of calling initialize(). Must not be null.
callback - a callback to notify whether the AmazonGamesClient is ready. Must not be null.
features - The features that are supported by the game. This will be displayed to the user.

isInitialized

public static boolean isInitialized()
Returns:
whether or not this AmazonGamesClient has been initialized and is ready.

getInstance

public static AmazonGames getInstance()
Returns:
an AmazonGames instance. The instance will be null if the client has not yet fully initialized.

getWhispersyncClient

public static WhispersyncClient getWhispersyncClient()
Retrieves an instance of the WhispersyncClient. Unlike the other clients, WhispersyncClient can be used immediately after calling initialize()

getLeaderboardsClient

public LeaderboardsClient getLeaderboardsClient()
Retrieves an instance of the LeaderboardsClient. Do not call getLeaderboardsClient() before the AmazonGamesCallback supplied to initialize() completes. If you do, you may receive a null client.

Specified by:
getLeaderboardsClient in interface AmazonGames
Returns:
LeaderboardsClient client object

public AchievementsClient getAchievementsClient()
Retrieves an instance of the AchievementsClient. Do not call getAchievementsClient() before the AmazonGamesCallback supplied to initialize() completes. If you do, you may receive a null client.

Returns:

setPopUpLocation

public void setPopUpLocation(PopUpLocation location)
Updates the pop up location for toast notifications with the given location object.

Specified by:
setPopUpLocation in interface AmazonGames

release

public static void release()
Releases resources and operations which only need to be running during an active game session. This should be called when the game leaves the foreground and should be paired with a call to initialize() once your game resumes in the foreground (ideally, this should be called in your activity's onPause() to compliment the calling of initialize() in your activity's onResume()).

shutdown

public static void shutdown()
Fully releases all resources and operations associated with an initialized AmazonGamesClient. Call this method when you are finished interacting with the GameCircle SDK (typically, when your game is exiting). Any subsequent interactions with the SDK will require a new call to initialize(). shutdown() should always be called when you are ready to shut down your application.
